thread.title: Last US Airways flight taking off from Philadelphia, stopping in Charlotte, Phoenix, San Fran
thread.title_full: Last US Airways flight taking off from Philadelphia, stopping in Charlotte, Phoenix, San Fran - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Associated Press
title: Last US Airways flight taking off from Philadelphia, stopping in Charlotte, Phoenix, San Fran
text:
PHILADELPHIA - The final US Airways flight is taking off from Philadelphia and stopping in Charlotte, North Carolina, then Phoenix and San Francisco.
Flight 1939, named for the airline's founding year, is scheduled to depart Philadelphia International Airport at 10:05 a.m. Friday and arrive in Charlotte about two hours later.
The Airbus A321 will return to Philadelphia on Saturday under the American Airlines banner, following the completion of a merger announced in 2013.
Pittsburghers were upset the flight wasn't stopping there. US Airways was formed in Pittsburgh as All American Aviation. It later operated as Allegheny Airlines before becoming USAir.
US Airways dropped Pittsburgh as a hub in 2004 and American Airlines shut down its nearby flight operations control centre in August, shifting about 650 jobs to Fort Worth, Texas.
__
This story has been corrected to show that the merger was announced in 2013, not 2003.
